intro: Lesquerella ovalifolia subsp. alba, commonly known as the white lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its narrow, ovate leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crop plants. The species is notable for its potential in biofuel and industrial applications due to its seed oil content.
